DOC.brief_summary: The objective retrospective study evaluate postoperative clinical outcome discharge , 1 month 12 month , associate use Parietex™ ProGrip™ Laparoscopic Transabdominal preperitoneal inguinal hernia repair . Results study use support short- long-term clinical outcome Parietex™ ProGrip™ use inguinal hernia repair laparoscopic approach . - Single center study - Population : All subject undergo Laparoscopic Transabdominal preperitoneal surgical treatment inguinal hernia repair Parietex™ ProGrip™ without additional fixation September 2008 March 2010 ( inclusive ) least 12 month follow-up . The primary outcome : • Proportion subject experience hernia recurrence ( defect treat initially Parietex™ ProGrip™ ) within 12 month post-surgery . Recurrence define clinically manifest bulge protrusion exacerbate Valsalva maneuver operate groin . The recurrence symptom assess phone base Symptoms Questionnaire recurrence diagnosis confirm physical examination physician define clinically manifest bulge protrusion exacerbate Valsalva maneuver operate groin . If subject surgical repair hernia within 12 month postoperative period , document evidence hernia recurrence . The secondary outcome : - Incidence Groin Pain ( pain score 0-10 ) analgesic use discharge , 1 month 12 month postoperatively - Incidence postoperative complication include , wound infection ( infection incision ) , mesh infection ( infection mesh ) , bleed , mesh migration , mesh erosion , fistula , small bowel obstruction , seroma , hematuria , hematoma , inflammation , chronic pains/ inguinodynia , infection , visceral adherence , allergic reaction component product discharge , 1month 12 month post-operatively - Patient satisfaction - Operative time - Hospital length stay
DOC.brief_title: TAPP Inguinal Hernia Repair With Self-fixating Parietex™ ProGrip™ Mesh
DOC.criteria: The following diagnosis include : Inguinal hernia : unilateral bilateral All subject must meet follow inclusion criterion : ≥18 year age Had undergone elective ( nonemergent ) primary surgical repair diagnosis Parietex ProGrip™ Laparoscopic Transabdominal preperitoneal inguinal hernia repair September 2008 March 2010 Postoperative followup ≥ 12 month recurrence occur within 12 month postsurgery ( If subject know incidence recurrence 12 month follow , subject include study . ) Subjects meet follow exclusion criterion eligible study participation : Patients previous laparoscopic Inguinal hernia repair Emergency procedures Patients incarcerated hernia
